alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:20AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Weakley, southeastern Obion, northern Carroll and southwestern Henry Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 519 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Troy, or 7 miles southwest of Union City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martin, Union City, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Troy, Kenton, Obion, Sharon, Routon, Henry, Rives, Sandhill, Mason Hall, Mansfield, Mount Pelia, Como and Ralston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
